intro: Potentilla nicicii, commonly known as the Nicicii cinquefoil, is a species of flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold and harsh environmental conditions. It has compound leaves with five leaflets, giving it the common name "cinquefoil." Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Potentilla nicicii is considered a rare and endangered species.
